name: Spell Points
description: This variant replaces the standard spell slot system with a pool of Spell Points. Instead of expending a spell slot, a caster expends Spell Points based on the spell's level. All Spell Points are regained after a Long Rest. Spells of 6th level or higher are each limited to one casting per Long Rest.

mechanics.replaces: Standard spell slot system for classes with the Spellcasting feature
mechanics.cantrips: Cantrips do not require Spell Points and function as normal at-will abilities
mechanics.highLevelRestriction: A character can cast a spell of 6th level or higher only once per Long Rest for each such spell level. For example, one 6th-level and one 7th-level spell are allowed, but two 6th-level spells are not.
mechanics.upcasting: To cast a spell at a higher level, pay the Spell Point cost of the higher level. For example, casting a 1st-level spell at 3rd level costs 5 Spell Points.
mechanics.recovery: All spent Spell Points and high-level casting restrictions are restored after a Long Rest
mechanics.multiclassing: Multiclass characters use their combined spellcaster level to determine their Spell Point maximum

interactions: Pact Magic (Warlock) is a separate feature from Spellcasting and retains its own spell slots even when this variant is in use
Sorcerer's Font of Magic should be adapted by the DM to convert between sorcery points and Spell Points at the listed costs
Wizard's Arcane Recovery should be adapted to restore an equivalent number of Spell Points rather than spell slot levels
Short Rests do not restore Spell Points unless another feature specifically grants Spell Point recovery
This system provides much greater flexibility for low-level spells at the cost of fewer high-level castings compared to standard slots
